column4: this place has a stink to it
column5: eh? I've not been here long myself
column6: but I can help you get the lay of the land if you want

column3: What kind of place is this?
Much the same as everyone else
column4: I s'pose─just tryin' to survive. Used to be a fisherman
column5: but then I got it into my head that Eulmore was the place for me. No more shiverin' on a boat
column6: or scalin' fish in a shack

column3: Wasn't long afore I realized my fishin' skills weren't exactly in high demand. Still
column4: Gatetown ain't so bad...not once you learn to ignore the smell
I've no desire to go back to where I was. When I left
column5: I cut ties with everything─my home
column7: all of it. I'm content to live on leavings from Eulmore's tables
column8: and await my chance to seize the good life.

column3: What? Gatetown? It's a place to feed on the scraps what fall on your face as you look up and hope and dream.
At least with Lord Vauthry in charge
column4: we've naught to fear from the eaters. And you can't hardly complain when they hand out food and ask for naught in return!

column5: ah... They say it's like livin' in a whole 'nother world. You just need to polish a skill
column6: and get yourself noticed by a free citizen. One day

column4: I hear them scraps weren't just some kind of fancy bread. They say we've been eatin' <Emphasis>eaters</Emphasis>. Ugh
column5: when I think of how much meol I've wolfed down
column6: it makes me sick to my stomach.

column3: Then there's what happened down here
column4: when things was going to pieces up there. All the old guard started muttering nonsense at the same bloody time
column5: like they was caught under some sort of spell. Not sure what to make of that...
